intro: Lenda hokutensis, commonly known as the Japanese lily, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and upright. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lenda hokutensis is considered a vulnerable species.
